channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Have a politically divided family? These tips help you talk across the dinner table
item.description: A 2022 survey found growing numbers of Republicans and Democrats think the other side is immoral and dishonest. Psychology and neuroscience research offers tools to help bridge that divide.
item.content:encoded: A 2022 survey found growing numbers of Republicans and Democrats think the other side is immoral and dishonest. Psychology and neuroscience research offers tools to help bridge that divide.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Carlson

item.title: Drugmakers and pharmacists battle over who gets to make obesity drugs
item.description: The pharmaceutical companies behind Ozempic, Wegovy and other weight-loss meds push to prevent compounding pharmacies from making cheaper copies. They argue they can keep up with demand on their own.
item.content:encoded:
The pharmaceutical companies behind Ozempic, Wegovy and other weight-loss meds push to prevent compounding pharmacies from making cheaper copies. They argue they can keep up with demand on their own.

(Image credit: James Manning/PA Images)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Western embassies in Kyiv shut due to Russian air attack threat
item.description: Russia promised a response to President Joe Biden's decision to let Ukraine strike targets on Russian soil with U.S.-made missiles.
item.content:encoded:
Russia promised a response to President Joe Biden's decision to let Ukraine strike targets on Russian soil with U.S.-made missiles.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The FDA says it found bacteria and a 'mold-like' substance at a Tom's of Maine plant
item.description: The agency is requiring Tom's to submit several documents, including assessments and remediation plans for its operations, contamination hazards, testing methods and more.
item.content:encoded:
The agency is requiring Tom's to submit several documents, including assessments and remediation plans for its operations, contamination hazards, testing methods and more.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: He's been nominated 32 times for CMA Musician of the Year -- but never won
item.description: Steel pedal guitarist Paul Franklin set a CMA record as a 32-time nominee for Musician of the Year. Will this year be different?
item.content:encoded:
Steel pedal guitarist Paul Franklin set a CMA record as a 32-time nominee for Musician of the Year. Will this year be different?

(Image credit: Rick Diamond)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Oarfish keep washing ashore in California. Folklore suggests that could be a bad omen
item.description: A deep sea oarfish washed up in Southern California. Japanese folklore suggests seeing the rare fish is a bad omen, some accounts say.
item.content:encoded:
A deep sea oarfish washed up in Southern California. Japanese folklore suggests seeing the rare fish is a bad omen, some accounts say.

(Image credit: Alison Laferriere)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: SS United States, record-setting ocean liner, makes its final voyage
item.description: The SS United States, a record-breaking 1950s ocean liner, may soon sail from Philadelphia to the Gulf. NPR explored this ship, a relic of the grand liners that once connected North America with Europe.
item.content:encoded:
The SS United States, a record-breaking 1950s ocean liner, may soon sail from Philadelphia to the Gulf. NPR explored this ship, a relic of the grand liners that once connected North America with Europe.

(Image credit: Stephen Mallon for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: 'Rust' premieres three years after a fatal on-set shooting
item.description: Three years ago, cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed when a gun held by Alec Baldwin went off on set. Her husband settled a wrongful death suit to become a producer of the film, which premieres in Poland on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Three years ago, cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed when a gun held by Alec Baldwin went off on set. Her husband settled a wrongful death suit to become a producer of the film, which premieres in Poland on Wednesday.

(Image credit: Andres Leighton)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: A surge in mass attacks has killed dozens in China in recent months
item.description: Dozens of people have been killed in China in the past three months in a series of mass attacks. The latest on Tuesday saw primary school students injured by a car as they arrived for classes.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of people have been killed in China in the past three months in a series of mass attacks. The latest on Tuesday saw primary school students injured by a car as they arrived for classes.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Residents in Haiti's capital stand with police in a battle to repel gang attack
item.description: Residents have been angered by the latest gang attacks. Violence forced Haiti's main airport to shut down last week after the country swore in a new prime minister.
item.content:encoded:
Residents have been angered by the latest gang attacks. Violence forced Haiti's main airport to shut down last week after the country swore in a new prime minister.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
